sub_topic: Finding the projection of one vector onto another using trigonometry
message_1: A force of 20 N is acting towards North-East direction, and another force of 10 N is acting towards East direction. Find the projection of the 20 N force onto the 10 N force using trigonometry.
message_2:
To find the projection of the 20 N force onto the 10 N force, we need to find the component of the 20 N force that is acting in the East direction.

Since the 20 N force is acting towards the North-East direction, it makes an angle of 45 degrees with the East direction. We can use the cosine function to find the projection of the 20 N force onto the East direction.

Projection = Magnitude of the force × cos(angle)

Projection = 20 N × cos(45°)

Since cos(45°) = √2/2,

Projection = 20 N × (√2/2)

Projection = 10√2 N

So, the projection of the 20 N force onto the 10 N force is 10√2 N.
